thread.title: Amtrak to start charging excess baggage fees
thread.title_full: Amtrak to start charging excess baggage fees

title: Amtrak to start charging excess baggage fees
text:
CNN Leadership
Amtrak to start charging excess baggage fees Updated 2049 GMT (0349 HKT) September 30, 2015 10 photos: 10 busiest Amtrak train stations 1. Many subway lines conveniently drop travelers off at New York City's Penn Station , which is the busiest Amtrak station. It hosted more than 9.5 million riders in 2013. Hide Caption 1 of 10 10 photos: 10 busiest Amtrak train stations 2. Union Station in Washington came in second place on Amtrak's list of busiest stations, with more than 5 million passengers in 2013. In addition to Amtrak, Washington's metro system and Maryland and Virginia commuter rails all stop at the station. Hide Caption 2 of 10 10 photos: 10 busiest Amtrak train stations 3. Philadelphia's 30th Street Station. The third busiest Amtrak station, 30th Street Station had more than 4 million passengers in 2013. The station features Karl Bitter's 1895 "Spirit of Transportation." Hide Caption 3 of 10 10 photos: 10 busiest Amtrak train stations 4. Chicago's Union Station , which had more than 3.5 million travelers in 2013, hosted a seventh annual National Train Day celebration in 2014. Hide Caption 4 of 10 10 photos: 10 busiest Amtrak train stations 5. Los Angeles' Union Station. Yes, Los Angeles has an Amtrak train station that connects passengers to Metrolink commuter trains, the Metro Rail subway, light rail lines and buses. More than 1.6 million Amtrak passengers traveled through the station. Hide Caption 5 of 10 10 photos: 10 busiest Amtrak train stations 6. Boston's South Station , which hosted more than 1.4 million passengers in 2013, also provides connections to the city's MTBA ("T") train, buses and commuter rail lines. Hide Caption 6 of 10 10 photos: 10 busiest Amtrak train stations 7. Sacramento, California. More than 1.1 million Californians took the train through Sacramento rather than drive. Hide Caption 7 of 10 10 photos: 10 busiest Amtrak train stations 8. Baltimore Penn Station . The Baltimore train station hosted just over a million passengers, ranking it as the eighth most popular train station. Hide Caption 8 of 10 10 photos: 10 busiest Amtrak train stations 9. Albany-Rensselaer, New York, rail station. It's over seven hours on the train from New York City to the state capital of Albany, but there's enough traffic (764,000 passengers) to make this station ninth busiest. Hide Caption 9 of 10 10 photos: 10 busiest Amtrak train stations 10. New Haven, Connecticut, train station. New Haven hosted 745,000 passengers in 2013, enough for it to round out Amtrak's top 10 list. Hide Caption
